intro: Karpatiosorbus kmetiana, commonly known as the Carpathian rowan, is a deciduous shrub native to the Carpathian Mountains in Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers in spring, followed by red berries in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
